definition: Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀

sentences.english: It is easy to misconstrue confidence as arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 很容易將信心誤解爲傲慢。

sentences.english: Pride and prejudice, money, matrimonial value orientation, marriage.
sentences.chinese: 傲慢與偏見，金錢，婚姻價值取向，婚姻觀。

sentences.english: An arrogant person will act as though he is better than others.
sentences.chinese: 一個傲慢的人總表現出好像比別人技高一籌的德行。

sentences.english: Why does he choose young Joseph, who's an arrogant spoiled brat?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他選擇了雅各布這個侍寵而傲慢的孩子？

sentences.english: Hubris has a big impact here too.
sentences.chinese: 傲慢在這裏也有很大的影響。

sentences.english: Social networks can act as a counter-weight to arrogant bureaucracies.
sentences.chinese: 社會網絡可以用來平衡一下傲慢的官僚機構。

sentences.english: The publisher has brought out the latest Chinese version of Pride and Prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 出版商出版了最新的《傲慢與偏見》中譯本。

sentences.english: Tom Wilkinson is his arrogant and lascivious patron.
sentences.chinese: 湯韋堅遜是華米亞傲慢及好色的主顧。

sentences.english: I won’t stand for the friend of yours who highhats.
sentences.chinese: 我再也受不了你那位舉止傲慢的朋友了。

sentences.english: Buckwheat leaned backwards much more arrogantly than before.
sentences.chinese: 蕎麥往後挺了挺身子，比以前更加傲慢了。

sentences.english: Allies can be treated so cavalierly .
sentences.chinese: 不能如此傲慢地對待盟友。

sentences.english: They were pround, conceited fellows, and they very soon began to try to make Columbus uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他們全是傲慢自大的人，很快就使哥倫布感到不快。

sentences.english: Less of Mr Bush's Manichaean arrogance would be welcome.
sentences.chinese: 少一些布什先生那種摩尼教徒式的傲慢將更爲討好。

sentences.english: Doesn't your great pride fear the gods any longer?
sentences.chinese: 你已經傲慢自大到連神都不敬了嗎？

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
